alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Indiana; Washington; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON...SOUTHWESTERN INDIANA...SOUTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY AND CENTRAL WESTMORELAND COUNTIES... At 359 PM EST, snow showers were located over North Braddock, or near McKeesport, moving east at 35 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with these snow showers. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Monroeville, Greensburg, McKeesport, Jeannette, Latrobe, Gastonville, Shaler Township, Plum, West Mifflin, North Side Pittsburgh, Baldwin, Upper St. Clair, Murrysville, Wilkinsburg, Whitehall, and South Park Township. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 50 and 57. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 53 and 84. Parkway North between mile markers 1 and 2. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 70 and 84. Snow will lead to reduced visibilities and hazardous travel conditions. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this intense snow shower. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location.
